title: Socratic Grilling
summary:
Key Ideas:
- Noticing confusion is an important rationalist skill.
- Students asking questions to resolve their confusion should not be shut down.
- It is important to think of questioning as Socratic grilling rather than a status grab.
- It can take many iterations to fully understand a concept.
- Vast inferential distances can make it challenging to understand a concept.

Key Learnings:
- It is important to cultivate the desire for things to make sense in order to become a good thinker.
- Tolerating confusion can be difficult, but it is necessary for learning.
- Good teachers will not get mad at students for asking questions.
- Teachers should assume their students are trying to understand and should respond accordingly.

Key Questions:
- How can educators promote a culture of curiosity and questioning in their classroom?
- How can one differentiate between a genuine attempt to resolve confusion and a status grab?
- How can one signal their own confusion without being seen as arrogant or combative?
